body:
Can confirm that after using Linux Environment the Locations aren't malformed:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10991802/83669504-97ae1800-a5c9-11ea-8691-7317fb7ff212.png)


Compared to artifacts created using a Windows Environment:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10991802/83669609-bad8c780-a5c9-11ea-893e-9c3b81a39069.png)
I am also facing the same issue with sklearn ElasticNet model from ML Flow Windows Client -
@mc55boy @sijuveugin Thanks for reporting the issue. Does the same thing occur when you log artifacts in local instead of an SFTP file store?

Hi Harutaka,

While logging artifacts in local it is fine.
This is an issue with pysftp client only.

On Thu, Jul 23, 2020, 4:27 AM Harutaka Kawamura <notifications@github.com>
wrote:

> @mc55boy <https://github.com/mc55boy> @sijuveugin
> <https://github.com/sijuveugin> Thanks for reporting the issue. Does the
> same thing occur when you log artifacts in local instead of an FPT file
> store?
>
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/issues/2844#issuecomment-662882680>, or
> unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AD72WUXWGKD6RWO4EC7B3TDR47X7ZANCNFSM4NDQASWA>
> .
>
@sijuveugin Thanks for the reply. Are artifacts stored correctly in an SFTP file store?

FPT - Hope you mean SFTP.

Only the file path issue is there. Files are not corrupted. If we refactor
file path everything will work fine.

Thanks
Siju Eugin

wrote:

Great

wrote:

> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub

> unsubscribe

@sijuveugin Looks like the issue has been fixed using [this stackoverflow answer](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/58460718/python-pysftp-put-r-does-not-work-on-windows).

@sijuveugin Opened a PR ⬆︎⬆︎⬆︎. You can try the fixed version MLflow with:

```
pip uninstall mlfow
pip install git+https://github.com/harupy/mlflow.git@fix-sftp-artifact-for-windows
```
